note.p: Birth: Croxton Park, Norfolk, England (02 February 1680)
Education: Norwich School; Pembroke College, Cambridge. BA (1701), MA (1704), DD (1728)

Career: Fellow of Pembroke (1703); Private tutor to Sir Wolston Dixie at Emmanuel College (1704); Ordained deacon and priest (1716); Rector of Orton Waterville, Huntingdonshire (1716-1751); Vicar of Cherry Hinton, Cambridgeshire (1729); Master of Pembroke (1733-17790); Vice-Chancellor of Cambridge (1733-1734); Lowndean Professor of Astronomy (1750-1770); Rector of Bradwell-near-the-Sea, Essex (1751); Vice-Chancellor of Oxford (1769); benefactor of Pembroke College
Proposers: George Graham; William Rutty; John Theophilus Desaguliers
References: A Rupert Hall, 'Cambridge: Newton's legacy' in NR 2001 vol 55 pp 205-226
Mari Williams, 'James Bradley and the Eighteenth Century "Gap" in Attempts to Measure Annual Stellar Parallax' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 83-100
L B Glyn, 'Israel Lyons: a short but starry career. The life of an eighteenth-century Jewish botanist and astronomer' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 275-305
Notes: First proposer's identity likely, but not certain
